_comment: Configuration file for Hyperliquid Trading Bot
_comment_security: NEVER commit this file with real credentials!

_instructions.private_key: Your Ethereum private key with 0x prefix (for Hyperliquid)
_instructions.wallet_address: Your Ethereum wallet address (agent wallet for Hyperliquid)
_instructions.testnet: true for testnet, false for mainnet
_instructions.symbol: Trading pair (BTCUSDT, ETHUSDT, SOLUSDT, BTCUSDC, ETHUSDC, etc.)
_instructions.dry_run: true to simulate trading without real orders
_instructions.max_position_size_pct: Max position size as % of equity (0.1 = 10%)
_instructions.max_daily_loss_pct: Max daily loss as % of equity (0.05 = 5%)
_instructions.max_trades_per_day: Maximum number of trades per day

health_monitor.enabled: Enable HTTP health check endpoint (requires Flask)
health_monitor.host: HTTP server host (127.0.0.1 for localhost only, 0.0.0.0 for all interfaces)

order_tracking.max_retries: Maximum retry attempts for failed orders (default: 3)
order_tracking.retry_delay: Delay between retry attempts in seconds (default: 2.0)
order_tracking.status_check_interval: Interval between order status checks in seconds (default: 5.0)

multi_timeframe.higher_timeframe: Higher timeframe to check (e.g., '4h' if trading on '1h', '1d' if trading on '4h')

websocket.enabled: Enable WebSocket for real-time data (default: false)
websocket.max_reconnect_attempts: Maximum reconnection attempts before fallback to REST (default: 10)

_environment_variables.note: You can override credentials using environment variables:

_security_notes: NEVER commit config.json with real credentials to git
Use environment variables for production deployments
Keep private keys secure and never share them
Use testnet for development and testing
Start with dry_run=true to test strategy
